x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Millions in humanitarian aid (food, medicine, supplies) never reach the people who need it. Donated goods often get stuck in warehouses, expire, or are lost due to a lack of digital tracking between the large international donors and the small, local distribution points. This breakdown destroys trust and reduces the effectiveness of all global aid efforts.

How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

A digital platform designed to create a verifiable, end-to-end "passport" for every major donated asset from its source (Donor) to its destination (Recipient):

  • Asset Management (ITAM/Custom): Every significant donation (e.g., a pallet of rice, a box of vaccines) is tagged as a digital Configuration Item (CI) with a unique QR code.
  • Service Catalog/Request Management: Local aid centers request specific items (e.g., "Need 100 units of Baby Formula") via a secure catalog, preventing overstocking and ensuring needs match supply.
  • Flow Designer & Now Mobile: The mobile app provides a simple, scanner-based workflow. When an item is moved (from port, to warehouse, to village), the scan updates the CI record, creating an auditable, real-time tracking trail.
  • Performance Analytics (PA): Gives international donors and the public transparent metrics on when and where aid was actually delivered.
